description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the hostname of the Datadog Agent.
description.codeComment: Sets the hostname of the Datadog Agent.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the hostname for DogStatsD metric collection.
description.codeComment: Sets the hostname for DogStatsD metric collection.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the port for DogStatsD metric collection.
description.codeComment: Sets the port for DogStatsD metric collection.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the URL for DogStatsD. This takes precedence over `DD_DOGSTATSD_HOST` and `DD_DOGSTATSD_PORT`.
Set the application's environment, for example: `prod`, `staging`.
description.codeComment: Set the application's environment, for example: `prod`, `staging`.

description.rustPublicDoc: Enable or disable telemetry data collection and sending.
description.codeComment: Enable or disable telemetry data collection and sending.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the internal log level for the tracer. Valid values: `DEBUG`, `INFO`, `WARN`, `ERROR`.
description.codeComment: Sets the internal log level for the tracer.
Enable or disable OpenTelemetry metrics export.
description.llmCodeDeduction: When `false`, metrics export is disabled and the library returns a no-op `SdkMeterProvider`. When `true`, metrics are exported via OTLP unless disabled by `OTEL_METRICS_EXPORTER=none`, an unsupported protocol (`http/json`), or missing transport features (`metrics-grpc`/`metrics-http`).

description.rustPublicDoc: Enable or disable remote configuration. Also accepts the alias `DD_REMOTE_CONFIG_ENABLED`.
description.codeComment: Enable or disable remote configuration.

description.rustPublicDoc: Interval in seconds for polling remote configuration updates.
description.codeComment: Interval in seconds for polling remote configuration updates.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the service name for your application.
description.codeComment: Sets the service name for your application

description.rustPublicDoc: A list of default tags to be added to every span, in `key:value` format, separated by commas. Example: `layer:api,team:intake`.
description.codeComment: A list of default tags to be added to every span, in `(key, value)` format. Example: `[(layer, api), (team, intake)]`.

description.rustPublicDoc: Interval in seconds for sending telemetry heartbeat messages.
description.codeComment: Interval in seconds for sending telemetry heartbeat messages.

description.rustPublicDoc: Enable or disable log collection for telemetry.
description.codeComment: Enable or disable log collection for telemetry.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the port of the Datadog Agent for trace collection.
description.codeComment: Sets the port of the Datadog Agent for trace collection.

description.rustPublicDoc: Sets the URL of the Datadog Agent. Example: `http://localhost:8126`. This takes precedence over `DD_AGENT_HOST` and `DD_TRACE_AGENT_PORT`.
description.codeComment: Sets the URL of the Datadog Agent. This takes precedence over `DD_AGENT_HOST` and `DD_TRACE_AGENT_PORT`.

description.rustPublicDoc: Set to `false` to disable tracing.
description.codeComment: Set to `false` to disable tracing.

description.rustPublicDoc: Enable partial flushing of traces.
description.codeComment: Enable partial flushing of traces.

description.rustPublicDoc: Minimum number of spans in a trace before partial flush is triggered.
description.codeComment: Minimum number of spans in a trace before partial flush is triggered.

description.rustPublicDoc: When set to `true`, stops extracting after the first successful trace context extraction.
description.codeComment: When set to `true`, stops extracting after the first successful trace context extraction.

description.rustPublicDoc: A comma-separated list of propagation styles to use for both extraction and injection. Supported values are `datadog` and `tracecontext`. See Propagating Rust Trace Context for more information.
description.codeComment: A list of propagation styles to use for both extraction and injection. Supported values are `datadog` and `tracecontext`.

description.rustPublicDoc: A comma-separated list of propagation styles to use for extraction. When set, this overrides `DD_TRACE_PROPAGATION_STYLE` for extraction.
description.codeComment: A list of propagation styles to use for extraction. When set, this overrides `DD_TRACE_PROPAGATION_STYLE` for extraction.

description.rustPublicDoc: A comma-separated list of propagation styles to use for injection. When set, this overrides `DD_TRACE_PROPAGATION_STYLE` for injection.
description.codeComment: A list of propagation styles to use for injection. When set, this overrides `DD_TRACE_PROPAGATION_STYLE` for injection.

description.rustPublicDoc: Maximum number of traces to sample per second.
description.codeComment: Maximum number of traces to sample per second. Only applied if trace_sampling_rules are matched

description.rustPublicDoc: A JSON array of objects to apply for trace sampling. Each rule must have a `sample_rate` between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).
description.codeComment: A JSON array of objects to apply for trace sampling. Each rule must have a `sample_rate` between 0.0 and 1.0 (inclusive).

description.rustPublicDoc: Enable computation of trace statistics.
description.codeComment: Enable computation of trace statistics.

description.rustPublicDoc: Maximum length of the `x-datadog-tags` header in bytes.
description.codeComment: Maximum length of the `x-datadog-tags` header in bytes.

description.rustPublicDoc: Set the application's version, for example: `1.2.3` or `6c44da20`.
description.codeComment: Set the application's version, for example: `1.2.3` or `6c44da20`.
Set the OTLP general endpoint URL (fallback for metrics endpoint).
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the base URL for sending OTLP data for all signals unless overridden.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Used only for OTLP metrics export: if `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_METRICS_ENDPOINT` is unset/empty, this value is used. If both endpoints are empty, the library derives the host from `DD_TRACE_AGENT_URL` (or `localhost` if unparsable) and uses port `4317` (gRPC) or `4318` (HTTP).

description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies a comma-separated list of key-value pairs to be used as headers on all outgoing OTLP requests (for example, `api-key=key,other-config=value`).
description.llmCodeDeduction: Currently parsed/stored but not applied to outgoing OTLP metrics requests (headers are not set on the exporter), so it has no effect.
description._comment: llm deduction is wrong. As dd-trace-rs is a layer on top of opentelemtry crate, It does have an effect.

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP metrics endpoint URL.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the URL for sending OTLP metrics data. Takes precedence over the general `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT`.
description.llmCodeDeduction: If non-empty, used as the OTLP metrics endpoint. Otherwise falls back to `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_ENDPOINT`, then to `http://<DD_TRACE_AGENT_URL host>:4317/4318` based on protocol. For `http/protobuf`, `/v1/metrics` is appended if missing.

description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies a comma-separated list of key-value pairs to be used as headers on outgoing OTLP metrics requests (for example, `api-key=key,other-config=value`). Takes precedence over the general `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_HEADERS`.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Currently parsed/stored but not applied to outgoing OTLP metrics requests (headers are not set on the exporter), so it has no effect.
description._comment: llm deduction is wrong. As dd-trace-rs is a layer on top of opentelemtry crate, It does have an effect.

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP metrics protocol (grpc, http/protobuf, http/json).
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the OTLP transport protocol to use for metrics data. Takes precedence over the general `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_PROTOCOL`.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Overrides `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_PROTOCOL` for metrics export. Parsed values: `grpc`, `http/protobuf`, `http/json` (case-insensitive). Note: `http/json` is currently unsupported for metrics and disables metrics export; `grpc`/`http/protobuf` require the corresponding Cargo features (`metrics-grpc`/`metrics-http`).

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP metrics temporality preference.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the aggregation `temporality` to use for each instrument kind.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Controls metrics aggregation temporality. Accepted values: `delta` or `cumulative` (case-insensitive); empty/invalid values are treated as `delta`.

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP metrics timeout in milliseconds.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the timeout (in milliseconds) for a single outgoing OTLP metrics request. Takes precedence over the general `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TIMEOUT`.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Used as the exporter network timeout (ms) for OTLP metrics requests. If set to `0`, the library falls back to `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TIMEOUT`.

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP general protocol (fallback for metrics protocol).
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the transport protocol to use for all signals unless overridden.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Used as the fallback OTLP protocol for metrics when `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_METRICS_PROTOCOL` is unset. Parsed values: `grpc`, `http/protobuf`, `http/json` (case-insensitive). Note: `http/json` is currently unsupported for metrics and disables metrics export; `grpc`/`http/protobuf` require the corresponding Cargo features (`metrics-grpc`/`metrics-http`).

description.codeComment: Set the OTLP general timeout in milliseconds (fallback for metrics timeout).
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the timeout (in milliseconds) for all outgoing OTLP requests unless overridden.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Used as the OTLP exporter request timeout (ms) for metrics only when `OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_METRICS_TIMEOUT` is `0`; otherwise metrics timeout takes precedence.

description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the metrics exporter to be used.
description.llmCodeDeduction: If set to `none`, metrics export is disabled (no-op meter provider). Any other value is treated as enabled (the library always uses the OTLP exporter).

description.codeComment: Set the metric export interval in milliseconds.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the time interval (in milliseconds) between metric export attempts.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Used as the periodic export interval (ms) for the OpenTelemetry `PeriodicReader`.

description.codeComment: Set the metric export timeout in milliseconds.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Specifies the maximum allowed time (in milliseconds) to collect and export metrics.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Currently parsed but not used to configure the periodic metrics reader/exporter, so it has no effect.

description.codeComment: Set OpenTelemetry resource attributes as a list of `(key, value)` pairs.
description.opentelemetryPublicDoc: Key-value pairs to be used as OpenTelemetry resource attributes.
description.llmCodeDeduction: Parsed as comma-separated `key=value` pairs and used as the lowest-priority OpenTelemetry Resource attributes for metrics export (then overridden by `DD_TAGS` and explicit service/env/version).
